website_summaries.verdict: Outdoors, indoors, sand, or surf, these versatile sandals have a novel twist that sets them apart from the rest.
pros: Comfy interior offers heel cushioning, arch support, and a contoured foam footbed all wrapped up in a rugged, water resistant package that's specifically designed for the beach
Tough and durable sole not only provides great traction, but features a unique built-in bottle opener that's sure to spark some animated conversation in any setting
cons: As amusing as it may be, a bottle opener that's been walked on all day probably isn't the most practical or appealing tool for opening drinks

customer_reviews.title: Arch support is excellent
customer_reviews.text: This sandal gives a lot of high and firm arch support, and the arch lasts for the duration of use. This isn't a flimsy sandal. I'm worn them for years and the quality has stayed the same. This is a sandal that lasts. Excellent sandal especially for someone who can benefit from a firm arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: OMG I love these! My husband has some ratty old Jordan ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love these! My husband has some ratty old Jordan slip ons from high school and needed something to wear on vacation that wasn't falling apart. He kept refusingthe Rainbows (too "surfer boy", too expensive) and I decided to take matters into my own hands and surprise him. These are super affordable, high quality, sleek all black and not too flashy (or "surfer boy"??? idk lol) The coolest part about them is the bottle opener on the bottom which he LOVED. These are awesome. I like them so much too!
customer_reviews.author: BrittanyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Reef Fannings have been my go-to sandal for pretty much my entire adult life
customer_reviews.text: Reef Fannings have been my go-to sandal for pretty much my entire adult life. There's not much that can be said about them that thousands haven't said already. I will say that the textured surface does result in cracking/drying of my feet if I walk on them non-stop all day. It's been my only ding on the Fannings over the years. It's fairly rare that I'm literally walking on them non-stop all day, so this isn't a common occurrence. But, I have always kind of secretly hoped they'd eventually change the design to be less "texturey". Still my automatic buy when a current pair of Fannings gets worn down to the air "cushion" in the back heel.
customer_reviews.author: smilingTolerantly

customer_reviews.title: Best Fit, Style and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I never liked flip flops / sandals ... that is, until I found Reef's ... these sandals are comfortable and fit perfectly ... unlike other sandals, I never feel like these are going to fall off my feet ... they are also stylish and durable ... I live out on a farm and these sandals get treated roughly ... but they hold up very well to the punishment ... ever since my first pair, I've never wanted any other brand ...
customer_reviews.author: Rick Langdon

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but broke after 2 summers.
customer_reviews.text: Two years - two summers - and they broke. The toe strap came apart from the sole. For $60, I’d hoped he would get more than two summers. Sucks that a $10 pair of my flip flops is still perfectly fine after four years with about the same usage. Very comfortable, though.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Don't be cheap with shoes/sandals.
customer_reviews.text: These are the sandals that replaced a pair of sketchers that I had for YEARS. I bought a couple of cheapy pairs of sandals from other stores that were not comfortable, and broke after minimal use and decided to just buy a quality pair. I've had these for well over a year now, and they are very comfortable, and durable. I've walked along the coast on very sharp rock, through the desert, and they've been chewed on by my Irish setter and still work great. Once my current pair are no longer functional I will definitely be buying another pair... Oh yeah and it has a bottle opener on the bottom!
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: My feet feel great. Feels like I'm wearing shoes really
customer_reviews.text: Wow so far these sandals are incredible. I have had them for about a week and have worn them to the university and to the pool. My feet feel great. Feels like I'm wearing shoes really. The arch support I think is what does it. I haven't used the bottle opener, don't know if it would be sanitary, but I don't really care about it. It's a cool thing to show people, they always get really happy for some odd reason. They do need to be broken into (just wear them for a day), but after that its all smooth sailing. Hoping they last a while, but will most likely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Mario A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, fit well, bottle opener on bottom, well made.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these flip flops. They have the bottle opener on the bottom. These sandals have held up well even to the boat launch (which destroyed a few of my husband's other sandals, when you're standing in shallow water, your sandal gets stuck in the muck, and the thong pulls out). We're very happy with them. I typically watch for the $12 specials, because sandals don't last forever, but these sandals were definitely worth the $42 investment. They seem like they'll last a long time. Also, my husband is a size 12.5 U.S. in athletic shoes but the Reef size 12.0 fits him well for these sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin H

customer_reviews.title: It has a Bottle opener!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE REEF SANDALS! I have multiple pairs of Reef Sandals in different colors. They never disappoint me. They fit great and I wear them all day long without any discomfort at the end of the day. I've worn cheap flip flops and my feet are killing me after a couple hours but with my Reefs I have no worries. The bottle opener on the bottom of the sandal is a huge bonus and a party favorite now. Hanging out with friends, I have turned into the official bottle opener. "Hey watch! He can open the bottle with his Sandal!" It's great fun. Looks great. Feels Great. Can't wait to buy another pair!
customer_reviews.author: JBear

customer_reviews.title: The only sandals I'll wear.
customer_reviews.text: When I'm not at work I literally live in sandals 12 months out of the year, so I've certainly tried plenty of different flipflops. I freaking LOVE these things, I've worn them exclusively since they came out. I've only ever used the bottle openers a couple of times though... Kind of sketchy putting the sole of a flipflop someplace I plan on putting my mouth. Only complaint I have with the Fannings is they seem to develop Terminal Stink before they actually wear out. Still haven't figured out how to de-stench them. But that takes a long enough time to still make them a good value for their quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Whit

customer_reviews.title: Wears like seasoned slippers at first go
customer_reviews.text: No blisters, discomfort, abrasion or feeling like it needed a few attempts to wear it in. Walked the whole evening in it, brilliant!! But that bottle opener nonsense... Who in the world would think that after dragging the bottom of your footwear through God-knows-what, and then using it to open something that you would stick in mouth or touch with your lips, was actually a good idea? Blimey... And to have that metal piece scratching on wooden, marble, vinyl flooring.... Quite a lot of people at Reef must have been high or drunk or both to have it actually gone through the entire brain-storming to fruition process.
customer_reviews.author: Wei

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shape, bad material for the thong
customer_reviews.text: These are the most perfectly shaped sandals I've ever owned, and I can't say enough good things about their form. The bottle opener is cute, if gimmicky. The problem is the material that goes between the big and second toe: it's (fake?) leather, and the sides of it are rough on the skin. Usually, this piece is made out of soft nylon or rubbery plastic (which all too often has a seam that also scratches). It's a shame that this one bad design choice ruins an otherwise perfect sandal. It's still totally wearable for a few hours, but it's really uncomfortable for the whole day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I now own three pairs of Reef Fanning's
customer_reviews.text: What's more to say? I own three pairs of Reef Fannings. These are the most comfortable, dressy and casual flips you can wear. I have a super clean pair for summer nights when I need to dress up, a worn pair for daytime activities and a backup pair to change into in case my nice ones get worn out. The built in bottle opener has come in handy many times. The sole grip is good for around 2 years (depending on your wear frequency). These flips are well made of quality materials and they won't let you down or leave you stranded. I'd find it very hard to buy any other flip after having worn these for three+ years now.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Jackson

customer_reviews.title: 2 big toes up!
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1 year old pair of O'Neill sandals that I bought for a vacation. They had started to be painful to walk in. I read a lot of reviews and decided to give these a try. The price was right. I gotta say, I was skeptical at first as the texture of the sole is a little rough. The benefit of this became quickly apparent as it is easier to walk in sandals that you don't have to continually work to keep on your feet. These are great for that. And after a few wears, they perfectly conform to your feet giving terrific support. 2 big toes up!
customer_reviews.author: KirkinSanMarcos

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Reef flip flops to replace my favorite pair of Evolv flip flops (Evolv no longer makes the style I have loved for years). Overall, these fit well and are very comfortable. The bottle opener in the bottom of the shoe is a novelty but I don't actually use it (who wants to walk all over and then put your drink on the bottom of your shoe?!) I suppose if I were stranded on a beach with a six pack and no way to open it, I might reconsider the usefulness of this feature though. I would recommend these shoes, however I don't recommend using the bottle opener unless you just wear these around your house!
customer_reviews.author: Prince Charming & Snow White

customer_reviews.title: Mmmmm, foot beer! Very comfortable and well designed with beer drinkers in mind.
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are great. I bought my first pair 5 years ago and they were starting to look pretty rough. Decided to buy the same ones again hoping the quality had not changed and it appears that the build quality is still great. I have really abused the old ones from walking in rivers on sharp stones and rocks to having one lost (and later found floating ) while water rafting. Having the bottle opener on bottom is just an added bonus once you and your friends get past the fact that you're using the dirty bottom sole. After a few beers, you cease to care!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable after break in
customer_reviews.text: I almost sent these back because the strap was really tight around my foot. Instead I wore them as much as I could tolerate for a few days and the straps stretched to match my foot. Now i've had them for about 9 months and love them. I'm flat footed and sandals usually hurt after a little while of being on my feet, I could wear these all day long. The can get smelly, but a paste of baking soda and a small brush will take that away.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Worn for a week. Quality appears good. Heel is a bit tall, but I presume it will compress with months of usage. Bottle opener is convenient. Update: Left shoe thong strap broke today as I was walking though the back yard trimming trees. Right shoe appears to be bad off too. Lasted about 2 yrs worn maybe 2 days per week. The heel never compressed, which makes these flops a little tall in the heel in the long run. I didn't wear through the sole. The thong material frayed over time. Seems like a defect to me as the remainder of the shoe is basically fine.
customer_reviews.author: haley

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to those third-rate $5 sandals again
customer_reviews.text: I got really tired of those cheapie sandals. My left foot seems to do most of the heavy work and I frequently have to hobble back to the house on my right foot. Besides that, the frequency of having to go back to the store to purchase another pair was getting to be very annoying. So I dug down deeper in my pocket book and sprung for these sandals. So far, after a month they have served me well and show no signs of ripping out from the upper sole. So far I'm very pleased...haven't been back to that store for a month now...Yay!
customer_reviews.author: frogstomper

customer_reviews.title: Reef Rocks...
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Reef Flip flips and I love them all. I try to stick with the Fanning style. It's incredibly comfortable (I walked several miles in them without getting a blister) after a day or two of wearing them in. The bottle opener in the heal is cool but not super functional. I'm not sure I'd want to use it seeing as I may have stepped in dog poo or something else that I don't want near my beer. But in an emergency, I suppose I'd use the opener. I highly recommend these flip flops.
customer_reviews.author: PicklesMcGhee

customer_reviews.title: Flip Flop beer opener!! GENIOUS!!
customer_reviews.text: I can wear these all day! High quality and you can open your beer with them. Seriously, what else more can you ask for? I find myself walking across rocks with these sometimes, and feel stable and without feeling the rocks really beneath me, so plenty of cushion, thickness and comfort. Fits as expected. I wear a 11.5 or 12 in normal shoe, and an 11 fits perfect in sandal, so keep that in mind you dont need the "extra shoe space" when ordering your size. I liked my brown ones so much that I had to get the same black pair as well.
customer_reviews.author: MattJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the stores
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered these from Amazon. My first pair lasted about 5 years (I live in the Midwest so I don't wear year around). The stores change an additional $15 or more. Great buy and will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but run a little small and overpriced for flip flops.
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of Reef sandals. Pretty comfortable for a pair of sandals, but highly overpriced. Fit fluctuates slightly between styles. I've now ordered two styles, both size 13. These are slightly shorter and more narrow. I would most likely order up a size just to be safe. I'd rather have a little extra room than risk my feet nearly hanging over the edges. For reference, I fluctuate between a 13-14 based on shoe styles (hiking, sandals, running, casual, dress, etc.). 13 is usually a safe bet but I wish i would have gone with a 14 here.
customer_reviews.author: Cali Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of reef sandals
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased four pairs for myself over the years and recently purchased another for a gift. Buy a pair and they will quickly become your "Go too" leisurely footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Manbyk

customer_reviews.title: Good Go-To sandals
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for an upcoming E Caribbean trip. I am not an avid sandal wearer, but since I have narrow feet and also flat footed I need a GOOD sandal and will pay the price. I already have a pair of OluKai's which I LOVE. I found these sandals to be of good quality and very comfortable. These will probably be my daily go-to sandals and keep my OluKais for more dressier times. They fit well, even with my narrow feet and have good arch support. I would recommend these sandals if you don't want to pay the slightly higher price for the Olukais.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals
customer_reviews.text: I've had Reef sandles before. I enjoyed them very much, so when my old pair was wearing out, I got these. Iconic bottle cap opener on the bottom, & air cushion in the heel, these are great sandals for anyone condisering some. They are comforatable and while I was hesitant to buy what I considered to be expeisnive flip flops at first, these changed my mind. Well worth the price as they are durable and will stand up to most any conditions. Water, sand, beach, rocks, every day concrete jungle of the shopping mall, these sandals have you covered. Partially, Because they are open.
customer_reviews.author: Blam-o

customer_reviews.title: Best flip flops I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second pair of these after 5 years, several countries and literally hundreds of miles of walking around. The tan line on my feet has been visible long into each winter I've owned these. Even after all that time and abuse, the strap showed no signs of degradation and seemed it had another 5 years easy. The area of the toes had worn down to the point that you could almost see through them. Hopefully these are still available in another 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: RyanM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pair of flip-flops
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pair of flip-flops. I've been a loyal customer of Reef Sandals for many years. This is my second pair of this style, although I've had numerous styles. I've had the first pair of this style for a few years and have worn them often. I'm still happy with them. The new ones fit perfectly, with no excess space. My foot is a size 12 and the flip-flop is exactly size 12. Very comfortable, durable, stylish pair of flip-flops. I'd definitely recommend them to a friend. Buying Reef brand sandals/flip-flops has always been a positive experience.
customer_reviews.author: Billz

customer_reviews.title: Best Sandals Around (and a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Friends have been telling me for years to ditch my Adidas flip flops in favor of a pair of Reefs. "Nay!" I said. "I'll never surrender the spikey comfort of my well-word, three-striped footwear. Oh, how I wish I had heeded their advice sooner! These sandals are the most comfortable summer footwear I've ever used. Casual enough for the beach, but stylish enough to wear out to a bar with shorts or jeans, I've been using my reefs all summer and will continue to use them into the fall. If you're looking for some quality (read: not Old Navy $4) beach footwear, get a pair of Reefs!
customer_reviews.author: El Jefe

customer_reviews.title: True love.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Reef for years. If you want a durable sandal that flat out does the job buy Reef. They pretty much hold up to any normal use pattern, for years in my experience. They look great and there are enough styles to embarrass a fashionisto. The price is silly cheap. Just buy the damn things and see if you can wear them out. If you buy three pair you won't know what to do with the other two. You can wear one pair every day, all day, for years. What more can you ask? It's a sandal that outlasts most marriages. That's love.
customer_reviews.author: sculler

customer_reviews.title: great footbed for sandal and fit
customer_reviews.text: I have worn women's Reefs Fanning Sandals for a long time due to the way they fit and support my foot much more than any other flip flop I've ever worn. I wear them for everyday's errands as well as near the beach/lake. They stay on my foot (yes, I have worn them on rollercoasters). I am a female with a size 7 in women's Reefs Fanning sandals (my foot is somewhat wide) and have ordered these size 6 men's Reefs Fanning sandals because I am not a big fan of all the pinks and pastel colors as well as flower patterns they decorate the women's sandals with. It works!!! Love them.
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: Sandals for Years
customer_reviews.text: I've had these sandals for a couple years now and with nothing to do right now decided to write this review. Pros: 1) Very durable material (these sandals hold up in rain, grass, beach, sidewalk, etc) 2) Comfortable, these are really comfortable sandals I can wear them for hours and it doesn't hurt my feet. 3) Stylish 4) Reasonable price 5) Bottle opener at the bottom (but never used it) Cons: 1) No Cons whatsoever this is just a good pair of sandals. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Umar

customer_reviews.title: OMG let me take of my dirty sandal and open up this bottle that I will ...
customer_reviews.text: There is a bottle opener on the bottom of the sandal that will snag on things. I honestly don't see why that is incorporated in the design. "I need to open a bottle, OMG let me take of my dirty sandal and open up this bottle that I will put to my mouth". I really makes no sense. Its a completely useless feature that causes problems because it can snag on things, is a huge gaping hole for mud and street trash to get buried in. Without the bottle opener the sandal looks and feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: love these sandals...
customer_reviews.text: it's a little weird (if unhygienic) to have the bottom of my footwear so close to where I put my mouth, but I've saved the day at many a bottleopener-less event. They're also fairly supportive (hard to say about flip-flops) and stylish. I'm on my third pair -- the first pair started to fall apart after a few years (no complaints, they held together pretty well) and the second succumbed to my dog's separation anxiety, so the third pair is wearing in quite nicely. I typically wear a 7-7.5 men's shoe but have high arches, so the 8s seem to be fine -- .5 inches too long, if that, which makes me think they may run a little small.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Mays

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, the bottle opener is more a gimmick, but CAN be used.
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome! They're incredibly comfortable, I wear them all day during the warmer months. The in heel bottle opener is more a gag than a truly useful thing, I could have done with out, BUT I HAVE used it to open more than a couple beer bottles while at parties. The fit is perfect, the lenght may be just a tad short (An extra 1/4 to 1/2 inch would have made a difference) but all in all, well worth the money. It's warming up now and I just dug them out of storage for another year of not wearing real shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Nicely cushioned soles (Has a Nike Air Max sneaker sole feel)
customer_reviews.text: Quality flip flops without the cheap slapping noise cheap flip flops make when you walk. I bought these for a friend and they were very pleased! Stated they are very comfortable and they have been wearing them since they got them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These flip flops / sandals are the most comfortable pair of flip flops I’ve owned – it’s actually my second pair of these as, after seven years of a lot of use, my previous version needed to be retired. The tread stands up to repetitive walking on concrete and rocks, and the bottle opener at the bottom is very handy. Seeing as they are very long-lasting, the $27.27 I paid here on Amazon for the pair is a bargain. If you are looking for long-lasting and comfortable flip flops, I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Reef Flip-Flops
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a second pair since my dog ate all the straps off the first ones, otherwise I'd still be wearing them. 5-stars for comfort; I opted for Black/Silver color combo as the "tan" flip-flops are everywhere. One note about the heel section, dirt/skin/etc is more noticeable on the black material when compared to more natural colors. "Thirst Quenching Technology" (read: built-in bottle opener) is a novelty, but has come in handy once or twice for friends that aren't sqeamish about putting the bottom of a shoe on their beers.
customer_reviews.author: 22twain

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: A really good pair of Sandals. They've lasted me four years now, but that seems to be the life of them. Ironically its not the actual sandal part that is wearing out, its the straps on top. The actual shoe, of the sandal has plenty of tread left. Definitely will be buying again. For the most part this brand has won me over with quality.
customer_reviews.author: Core

customer_reviews.title: Best flipflops available
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about wearing flip flops in the summer, Reefs are a must have. You can actually wear these as real shoes for an entire day. This is not your $2 bargain bin special and you get what you pay for. The bottle opener comes in handy on the beach to open..uh...those sodas. These flip flops will not rub the inbetweens of your toes raw and really have no break in required. I have taken these hiking quite a few times. They have a surprising amount of traction.
customer_reviews.author: RainNW

customer_reviews.title: Hubs is happy
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these flops! He has skinny bony feet that hurt a lot if he wears flip flops around too much, but finds these really supportive on his heel especially, where he needs it most. He also says they are soft on top of his foot, don't chafe between the toes, and have good arch support. I'm sure the beer opener on the bottom doesn't hurt, since he is really into sports and tailgating during football season (we live in the south, so flip flops are common pretty much year round). I actually just replaced his old pair (about 5 years old!) with a new pair that is the same.
customer_reviews.author: KeriMans

customer_reviews.title: Feel great, seem to run small
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on at the local big box sports store before ordering from Amazon ($32 vs. the $50 the store wanted). I usually wear a 10-10.5, but I had to order an 11 in these because the 10 is much too small. These are very comfortable. I have worn them several times on all day walking activities (the zoo for example) and my feet were much more comfortable all day than in most flip flops. I was very hesitant to spend $30 on sandals, but they are definitely worth it. The bottle opener on the bottom is also a fun novelty and actually works well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Devenberg

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Sandal
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Reefs. My first pair lasted several years wearing them very regularly any time that weather allowed so I decided to get another pair. These are very comfortable for a pair of sandals, much more so than your average cheap pair. I wear them for hours with no comfort problems. These are definitely worth the extra money. It may seem a little crazy to spend this much on a pair of flip flops, but your feet will thank you if you wear them a lot like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: They Look Good
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad pair of sandals. I have purposely been wearing these for everything I do to test their durability. I have used these for mowing the lawn, shopping, working at home, walking on the beach, and many other things. They are still in good shape with no problems at all. One drawback is they do tend to collect dirt. The only way I've found out how to clean these is simply going to the beach and walking in water. These also run a bit large. If you wear a size 10 shoe, buy a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: David Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Have been buying these for years!
customer_reviews.text: My husband goes through sandals quickly (he wears them 300+ days a year here in Arizona!) and has tried many different brands/styles and within 3-5 months they are all worn out. So far Reef's Fanning Sandals in Brown/Gum last the longest, giving him over a years worth of wear. I have even purchased other colors for him in the Fanning style but they didn't last as long and seemed flimsy and made with thin rubber. Not sure why but the Brown/Gum chose is by far the best for a long lasting sandal! They wear well, are comfy and have great arch and heel support!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the odor!
customer_reviews.text: They look and feel great but they start to hurt the bottom of your foot after 3-4 hrs. The rough material starts to irritate the bottom of your foot as you get more friction. The worst part for me if that the leather on top will make your feet smell. I have never experienced a sandal that causes your feet to smell. I have tried washing it but it still causes the bad odor. It gets much worse in humid environments. On the plus side the bottle opener on the bottom is a plus and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: W. Samudio

customer_reviews.title: These are extremely comfortable and my favorite footwear.
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to wear flip flops for any extended period of time without having pain in between my toes. These are very comfortable and I could wear them all day without any pain. This is my second pair of Reef Fanning Flip Flops and I love them. My first pair are 2 years old and they have held up very well. I still wear them almost daily, it was just time for a "fresh" pair. The bottle opener on the bottom is mostly a conversation piece. Although it does actually open a bottle, there is something kind of gross about opening my bottle with the bottom of my shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals for the price!
customer_reviews.text: There are only a few things you want from a Sandal. Good fit, Good Looks, and Comfort. Is that so hard? Apparently, for many sandal makers - this is a huge struggle. I'm happy to report that these Sandals deliver on all of those requirements. I can't say they are the "best" at any of those requirements but, they certainly meet or exceed them all. As a little bonus, they have a bottle opener on the bottom of both Sandals. Seems stupid, but it has come in handy a few times. Overall, I'd recommend these Sandals for anyone who is interested.
customer_reviews.author: Erik G.

customer_reviews.title: Best sandals I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: These are more firm than I am used to, but after wearing them for only an hour I was used to them. These are the highest quality sandals I have ever worn. I used them exclusively while traveling abroad for 3 week and I use them every day now that I am home. Have owned them for two months and they are still like new. I had to google what that metal tab on the bottom was, I had no idea...it's a bottle opener on the shoe sole. Weird, but it works. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.  Love the bottle opener!
customer_reviews.text: As with all shoes, these felt a little tight to start, but they broke in after a couple of days and now I love them. They are very comfortable and have a good grip for walking. The bottle opener on the bottom of the shoe is brilliant. I went to river a few weeks ago and when we were all sitting around the fire that evening everyone was passing me their beer bottles to open them. It is a very sturdy opener and opens all kinds of beer bottles without any issues. It really makes you the hit of the party when no one has a bottle opener. lol. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Look good and last all season
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my guy (for Xmas) who loves them. He had a pair from last season and wore them just about every day (we're lake people). They look great and he loves how comfortable they are on his feet. The Reef's signature bottle opener underneath? OK it's a conversation piece, most beverages have twist off caps, who uses a bottle opener these days? Still, I can't tell you how many people notice it when he crosses his legs and comment on it. All in all, we both love these flip flops, they are WELL made and have recommended them to friends dozens of times.
customer_reviews.author: GawgaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow!!!
customer_reviews.text: These sandals fit much smaller than other Reef sandals I own (4 other pairs). I wear a size 10 Reef "Flex" sandal which fits perfectly in width and length. These Reef "Fanning" sandals are much narrower and slightly shorter in length. I don't have wide feet, yet when I wear them over a 3 hour period my feet go numb as the strap is too tight. I hope they stretch a bit during break in!!! I recommend getting the next size up, assuming the length is too short.
customer_reviews.author: BKraft

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is good. Bottle opener feature not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: These things have lasted 2 years. The bottle-opener on the bottom is meh and really only worked if you took off the saddle and used it like a normal bottle opener; kinda defeating the purpose in my mind. I was expecting this feature to work without having to take it off and look like a badass on the beach opening beer bottles with the bottom of my shoe. I'm giving it 5 stars anyway for the quality and longevity of the shoe which is really beyond expected. Would purchase more just because of how long this first pair lasted and how durable they are.
customer_reviews.author: Elysse Nicole

customer_reviews.title: People seem to love it when you flip one off your foot and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these for two years now! I wear them to the beach as well so they've been exposed to salt water, mud, hiking and the works. They are made quite well. People seem to love it when you flip one off your foot and open a beer bottle; very handy since I don't carry a bottle opener on my keychain. I don't know how long these will last, but when they do eventually break I'll have to buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: V. Doug Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for people who like cool (temp) feet
customer_reviews.text: I was getting tired of my Rainbows always staining my feet brown, and the tread getting slippery - so these reefs took care of both those problems, but the strap makes me feel like I'm wearing shoes temperature wise. It almost feels like neoprene. It's not - i'm not sure what its made of...but it doesn't breathe. I'm not saying the leather strap of rainbows was "breathable" but it was narrow enough to where it didn't bother me. These Reefs fit fine, are sturdy and comfortable enough to walk on... but I miss the the narrow strap from my Rainbows.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a pair of reef sandals that I bought around 7-8 years ago. I used them often in the summer months over the years. They were great but finally starting to wear out at the soles. I purchased the Reef Men's Fanning Sandal as they had the 1 inch cushioned heel. They are very comfortable, fit well, and I was surprised to discover they had a bottle opener on the bottom of each sandal! Although I haven't used it yet, it always makes for a nice conversation piece.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stricker

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: Great sandals. They were a little tight at first, but after a few days of moderate use, they broke in just fine. I wouldn't go crawling around on any beach rocks in them though, because uneven surfaces will catch and grind on the metal bottle opener if they hit the middle of your foot directly. It's a neat idea and a nice little bonus to have, but speaking in terms of practicality it takes away from the sandal. Still a solid buy though. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: NOT happy. I've owned many pairs of these sandals, and have had great luck with them over the years, but these are brutal! I question if these are genuine reef sandals. In the first two weeks of ownership stitching on the band that crosses my foot has begun to come out, and there is a huge flap of fabric now loose. Never had this happen, even with my old pair which was 3 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew piccolo

customer_reviews.title: Non durable...
customer_reviews.text: Update to my original review... they broke :( while on vacation... at the beach... after 3 years use... Really comfortable. I did not know what the thing on the sole was, until I saw the web that it was a bottle opener. Don't care much for that, but a great sandal. It begins to stink a little if you get it wet though, thats why the 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals. Considerably better than my rainbows
customer_reviews.text: Im a 12 and these fit true to size. They're more comfortable than my rainbows, they have air in the heel which is nice for walking comfort, the thong part doesn't wear on my toes, they're non-slip, look good, and have bottle openers on the bottom (not sure how much I'll use this but why not?!). Overall i'm very happy and even wear them around the house just because they're so comfortable. They're not clumsy, loose-fitting, or cumbersome at all even in my larger size. Best sandals I've owned to date. Did I mention they're comfortable?
customer_reviews.author: Mr Cummings

customer_reviews.title: best flips
customer_reviews.text: these flip flops are by far the best ones I've han in a long time. Comfy,no need to break them in it's like they were made for my feet...usualy there is a peorid where your feet need time to adjust to them not these. Shipping was fast. Would recommend these to anyone in need of summer footware. I did not relize there was a bottle opener on the bottom when i ordered them ..how cool is that! works great after a little time using them, now i have to buy beer that needs a opener..u know good stuff, not the every day stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ubfun

customer_reviews.title: Too high of expectations
customer_reviews.text: Owned a "cheaper" but similar sandal, the Quicksilver Session 2. The design and feel of each sandal on first blush are much the same. Squishy heel, soft thong to prevent blisters. However, the way it is stitched caused blisters on the top of my foot. The gel in the heel is hard after walking for more than a quarter mile (I could walk miles at a time in the Session 2's without an ounce of pain or fatigue). Hope they break in over time (Sessions required no break-in time) but wish I would've went with what I thought was the inferior brand.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: 3 years later, and husband still loves them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these flip flops for my husband three years ago. He is very hard on his shoes, tends to go through them very quickly, and therefore feels spending more than $20 on shoes is a waste because they'll get trashed anyway. I was apprehensive about spending this much on a pair of flip flops. These ended up being the only shoes he wears from May - October, and still in great shape even after 3 years. Even being pretty cheap, this is definitely a purchase either of us would make again.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sandals!!
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are perfect!! They are very comfortable and built very sturdy!! I like them so much I bought another pair in a different color!! If you're shopping around for sandals and can't decide, just buy these and save time as you can't go wrong!! Take it from me, a guy that wears sandals year round... They even have a bottle opener built into the bottom of the sandal except when I went to open a beer with them I got some dog crap all over my beer so I won't be using that feature again lol...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Creeden

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Customer
customer_reviews.text: These things are my perfect flip flop. I think I'm on my 3rd pair now after losing a couple. I tried out another brand in between this one and couldn't come back fast enough. Some pairs slant off your feet and don't stay snug but these seem to just hold their position wet/dry no matter your walking pace. Comfortable and durable, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: These are nice sandals, but they don't seem to be worth ...
customer_reviews.text: These are nice sandals, but they don't seem to be worth the money. They're much too stiff, making them very uncomfortable. I waited to see if they just needed a period of time to "break in", but it's been months now and they are as stiff as ever. The high heel doesn't add any comfort either, and actually makes them less comfortable because of how stiff they are. My $2 convenience store sandals were much more comfortable. The bottle openers are cool but there is never an opportunity to use them. I've heard olukais are better, maybe check them out.
customer_reviews.author: H. Shapley

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, bottle opener bad idea
customer_reviews.text: I love Reefs, and I swear by them. I'm not a big fan of these though, because of the bottle opener in the arch. After some time, it always starts slightly stabbing in the arch of the foot. You can either get used to it, or get a different pair. Other than that, these sandals will last 1 to 2 years being worn every day, and it's usually the piece that goes between your toes that goes first. Get Reefs, just get ones without the bottle opener.
customer_reviews.author: Bradly A.

customer_reviews.title: My go-to brand for flip flops.
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite brand of flip flops. In addition to being extremely comfortable, they are very durable. Having worn these for years I can say I have never had the toe-piece separate from the footbed nor had the soles separate. The heel cushion and arch support are way above average and the imbedded bottle opener is popular with my friends in Bali and Cambodia. I will order a pair as a gift for my Balinese friend who is a surf instructor.
customer_reviews.author: Harry the Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. I was skeptical at first, because all I had was pictures online. I wasn't sure about how sturdy they were as we were looking for something with arch support for him. Then I saw the bottle opener on the bottom of the shoe. Don't get me wrong, I don't think we'll ever use it, but it told me something about how sturdy the shoe has to be to use a bottle opener. When they arrived, I was amazed. They fit him great and are very comfortable to him. Good enough to me.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Reefs Sandals_Still a Flip Flop but a very good one.
customer_reviews.text: Have always been a fan of Reefs but very careful in trying to find a deal. That's what these sandals (excuse me, they'll always be flip flops to me) were, a good deal. Other aspects are the looks and the cushioned gel heel which of course helps with comfort as well as being stylish. Not all the reefs are priced just right so you have to go through a process of elimination to get the price you want. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: loubeau

customer_reviews.title: Toe strap broke after 1-1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable with a good tread pattern. The bottle opener is a novelty I was interested in but only used a few times as I was worried about pulling it out ot the sole. I am also not convinced the heel cushion is any more effective than some other approaches. My main complaint is that after only about a year and a half of casual use the toe strap broke. At this price point that is a deal breaker. I've had Wal-Mart flip flops last longer.
customer_reviews.author: JWF

customer_reviews.title: Only If You Like Parties And Want To Look Cool 'Cause You Have A Winning Surprise On The Bottom Of One Of Your Sandals!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, but not as comfortable as the Phantom Reefs. But these guys have a nice bonus feature.....for the time no one has a "church key".... you will become the darling of the beer drinking crowd your with.....maybe one of the cute girls.....assuming there are cute girls.....might hit on you. Just pop the correct sandal off, voila! A bottle opener on the bottom. You might just get invited back!
customer_reviews.author: M. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Not so terrific for tender toed seniors
customer_reviews.text: The strap that goes between one's toes is a piece of leather with an unfinished edge. It made a small cut between my toes. I sewed the sides together and it was much better. The footbed is quite excellent and if I hadn't had the problem with the leather, I probably would have given a higher rating. I haven't tried the bottle opener on the bottom of the sole, a rather useless feature I think (every beer I drink has a twist off cap).
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Thorson

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and durable
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I wanted to spend more than $10 on flippy-floppies, but now that I've had these all summer I'd say these are worth it. I chose these since my buddy has a pair that have held up for about 3 years, which is a good sign to me. The fit and finish is really good. The bottle opener in the sole is a total gimmick, but I guess can be cool sometimes. I wouldn't buy them for that feature though as fit and durability are more important to me, and these do really well in those departments.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: alcoholic footwear
customer_reviews.text: I am a footwear snob. If my feet hurt, I am miserable. So I am very picky about what supports my 240 lbs of awesomeness. These flops do a great job. They have a channel of air under your heel and - get this - a bottle opener built into the sole. So, when you've walked around the yard, house, beach, lake, or pool and need a cold one, just kick up your foot and pop a top!!
customer_reviews.author: Whiskey Charlie Lima

customer_reviews.title: These are the best sandals ever
customer_reviews.text: Order one size larger for the correct fit (this is what I did). These are the best sandals ever. Most flip-flops have rubber that goes in between my big and middle toe which bothers me, but these don't bother my feet at all due to that part being made out of some sort of soft cloth-like material.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The cushioning at the ball of the foot was completely compressed after two years of heavy use. They could skip the novelty of the bottle opener on the bottom of the soul. It collects mud if you walk in any. The vinyl that surrounds the toe strap came undone after about a year, but I cut it off and it made no difference in function or aesthetics. There is a reason these are one of the highest rated flips on the market. I've upgraded to a different flip, but keep these around as backups. You really can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzy M.

customer_reviews.title: Reefs have always been great for that and are a good value
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband to replace a very similar pair of Reef's that he had for years. In the meantime, he kept on buying cheap sandals to get by, and when I finally just bought these for him he was so grateful to finally have a proper pair of sandals. He spends basically all summer in them, and having a pair with cushion and that you can walk in for a long time is really important. Reefs have always been great for that and are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: erika

customer_reviews.title: Good comfy flip flops
customer_reviews.text: Good comfy flip flops. Look nice, function well, provide enough support that my legs aren't sore at the end of the day like I've experienced with some less comfortable shoes (even a lesser pair of Reefs). Not sure why there's a bottle opening on the back, nice gimmick I guess, but I really don't advise putting your beverage against the bottom of your shoes that you wear on dirty public streets or even your own dirty floors. Strange....
customer_reviews.author: JPN

customer_reviews.title: Reef rocks in Ohio
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased these Reef Sandals, I wasn't exactly what you would call the sandal wearing type. After all I live in Ohio where there is a solid 4-5 months of winter. Nonetheless, the Fanning Sandal has a great fit and I wore these guys when I would go out with friends on a casual summer night. Typically, I have lower back issues from standing too long, yet Reef has proven to be a reputable brand. The bottle opener on the bottom comes in handy at house parties to open your favorite beverage. All around awesome sandal for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brent J. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this brand of flip flops for close to ten years or so it seems. I love them. They are like a flip flop with the support of a tennis shoe. Extremely comfortable. They always fit well. I can wear them all day long. I tried other flip flops but I really love the support of this style of flip flop. It is the only thing I wear. They are nice and thick on the sole.
customer_reviews.author: Brycen Pike

customer_reviews.title: Best weapon in self defense and drinking beer
customer_reviews.text: Still wear these to this day. Some of the most comfortable pairs of sandals you'll ever throw on your feet. The best part about these bad boys is that there is a bottle opener on the bottom. You will never not be able to be the life of a party with these things on your feet. You can also use it to dig someones eye out if you're being attacked. Great tool all around.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mickelson

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as comfortable as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to time at my daughters swim meets, constanty getting wet then dry. The support is great, feet weren't tired at all at the end of the meet. But the top of them is really uncomfortable after standing for a while. If you are buying these to run the garbage out to the curb, they would be great. But as far a touting that these are comfortable to stand for any length of time over an hour or so, I would get something that stretches better as your feet swell.
customer_reviews.author: Flick

customer_reviews.title: Avoid The Grey/Vintage Blue Color...
customer_reviews.text: The Grey/Vintage Blue Color sandals don't stay clean and the dirt is highly visible on the light grey soles. After every few days of wearing them, the dirt/grime starts building up to unacceptable levels. I only wear them around town, on pavement, not on dirt. I have to wash them with soap, warm water, and a scrub brush every few days to keep them up to hygienic standards. It's a real pain. I've had other Reef sandals without this problem. Because of this, I recommend avoiding this color. Otherwise, they are comfortable and stylish. I just don't like the constant upkeep.
customer_reviews.author: Seraphim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent birthday gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a birthday present for my boyfriend last year and he absolutely loves them! He wore them all summer long and thoroughly impressed his friends when he used the bottom of it to open bottles of beer during cookouts and family gatherings. They were true to their stated size and he says that they're the most comfortable sandals that he's ever owned. I will absolutely be buying these again and again. Great price for a great sandal with the fun feature of the bottle opener on the bottom!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Third pair of Reefs
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most comfortable and long lasting flip flop ( which doesn't flip and flop ) I have ever worn. I still have the other two pairs and the original 6 or 7yr old pair which is worn but still going strong. The new color options are good but the "Brown /Wood" color looks like dirt on the top side which caused my wife to shriek when I opened a guest's beer with the sole opener last weekend. I probably should have chosen something else. Otherwise great sandal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gold

customer_reviews.title: Good but Expensive Flip Flops
customer_reviews.text: These flip flops are expensive but they are comfortable and safe to walk on wet surfaces -- I use them in my backyard or go outside my house to pick up the mail or take out the trash and recycle bins for pickup; I feel relatively steady and safe wearing these flip flops in the rain or on wet surfaces. These flip flops weight just heavy enough to make wearing them very comfortable on any surface.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hwee

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable sandals I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable sandals I've ever owned. Had a pair before that lasted me about 4 years until the part between the toe came out from the base but figured I had gotten my moneys worth for the amount of miles I put on them. I'm also not proud to say that I've used the bottle opener on the bottom as I find it to be kind of gross but it has actually come in clutch a time or two. Well worth the money for these things
customer_reviews.author: CayoT

customer_reviews.title: Feel awesome on feet.
customer_reviews.text: I've never spent more than $20 on a sandal before but after having these for a few month now I can see what I've been missing. These are very comfortable underfoot and ergonomically fits my foot perfectly. My heel does not slide off to one side or the other. I read a few bad reviews among many good reviews and decided to take a chance. I'm glad I did. Haven't had them long enough to give any feedback on longevity but I found fit and feel while wearing to be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Brier Bear

customer_reviews.title: Reef fan for life
customer_reviews.text: Reef's are consistently comfortable from my experience, I've bought many pairs of them over the last 6 years. They hold up to sand and sea, never making my feet feel tired or sore. I've worn them at theme parks, on vacations, and all sorts of long walks. I live in Florida, sandals are year round attire here and we take them seriously. I highly recommend Reef's - this particular pair of black sandals has not disappointed me at all.
customer_reviews.author: David Rippel

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, But Makes Sounds When You Walk
customer_reviews.text: They make a little noise when I walk in them, which is odd. I thought it'd stop doing that after a week or two of breaking them in, but nope. A month later and they still sound weird in quiet rooms. The height of the straps were a little tight for me out of the box, but after about a week of wearing them in they fit perfectly. Very comfy and would recommend them if you don't mind a little noise :)
customer_reviews.author: Corry Frydlewicz

customer_reviews.title: Reef Fanning
customer_reviews.text: Been a Reef Smoothy fan for years but needed something a bit more heavy duty for work (pool service tech); bought a pair in Clearwater and they worked out great but were pricey, so checked Amazon and decided to buy a pair for 'best' some $20 cheaper. These flips are really comfortable as there is a slight rise in the heel, this makes them more rigid than the smoothies which is great for work comfort and for walking. Don't imagine I will ever use the bottle top opener but you never know!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have somewhat messed up ankles and have always had problems with finding sandals that provided any level of support. These sandals are very comfortable, and because of the cushioning in the heel I have had no discomfort whatsoever. They have a bottle opener on the bottom, but I've never used it so I can't speak to its effectiveness. I strongly recommend these sandals to anyone who wants to wear flip flops but has problems with ankle/heel support.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lampen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, supportive
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd pair of Reefs - finally wore out the first pair sfter 4 years of daily wear when the piece of fabric holding the foot strap to the sole tore. My shoe size is 9.5 M so I ordered the size 10 and it fits perfectly. Comfortable, supportive, good grip on wet or dlippery surfaces. First thing i do when i get off work is pull my work boots and socks off and slip into my Reefs.
customer_reviews.author: WILLY P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect summer sandal
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for our honeymoon 5 years ago. Then his brother liked them so much he stole them. My husband loves them especially for the bottle opener on the bottom. So, I decided it was time to get him another pair for our trip to Florida. I think they look nice enough to wear to church in the summer but casual too. The only tip, though, it to try not to get them wet like any leather sandal. They did get a little smelly after they got wet.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Been wearing these shoes for years, no issues
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this same brand/design of Reefs for the last 8 years or so. This purchase was my third pair in those years and they lasted the test of time. Each pair lasted around 4 years and I eventually had to buy new ones because the rubber bottom eventually wore out from use on one side (My feet lean in so more pressure is added to the inside of the shoes). These sandals are very comfortable, fit well, and will last. Other sandal straps tend to hurt my feet when I wear them, but these work great. I highly recommend these sandals, they are one of the best!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Levi Lewis

customer_reviews.title: ... I wore the hell out of them) and was pretty butt-hurt about it
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of reef sandals for almost five years before they fell apart (and I wore the hell out of them) and was pretty butt-hurt about it. I'm kind of a cheap bastard and didn't want to spend $40 on another pair of sandals but eventually sucked it up and ape the money. Glad as hell that I did. It takes a little while to break them in but damn are they comfortable. They're basically my lazy man foot wear from May through November.
customer_reviews.author: B. Berger

customer_reviews.title: BEST flip flops
customer_reviews.text: The BEST flip flop you can buy. They are expensive, but you can catch them on deals from time to time. While expensive, they last literally forever and feel like you are wearing a tennis shoe, not a flip flop. The fit is perfect and extremely comfortable. This is the ONLY flip flop I recommend to anyone looking to buy. Buy a pair, they are an investment!
customer_reviews.author: poopshakes

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Pair and love them
customer_reviews.text: I discovered these sandals 5 years ago. My first pair just wore out and I wear them almost every day between the months of April to Setpember. Even in the winters. If you are looking for a comfortable pair of sandals to wear around the all day hustle and bustle of an amusement park these are your sandals. Tight enough fit so you won't lose them on the rides and also soooo confortable that you won't get any bllisters. I would recommend them to anyone and I have to many.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the sandals and the swelluar fit like all my other reefs
customer_reviews.text: Until this year I only bought fannings for the last 4-5yrs. This year I bought Fannings and swelluar sandals. My size is a 44, I ordered the sandals and the swelluar fit like all my other reefs, this time the fannings we kinda small on me. I'm sure it will stretch out once I get them wet, just a little odd that's all. I do love the sandal though, I'll still buy them again and again. Love them for all day comfort, totally worth the money. If you're thinking about buying these you shouldn't even hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schillaci

product_meta.title: Reef Men's Fanning Speed Logo
product_meta.description:
Reef sandal

Reef is surf. They're inspired by water, by the ocean, by perfect waves, and the journey along the way to find them. They are a genuine, global surf brand that harvests the best of the lifestyle and shares it through authentic, innovative and fashionable product. At the core of Reef is their Latin roots and the inherent sensuality of the beach. The Reef team is committed to having fun in and out of the water, as well as giving back to the world that inspires them.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
Logo-accented flip-flop featuring air-cushion heel and concealed bottle opener on outsole
